website_summaries.verdict: This is a great option if you're looking for an affordable hitch step that doesn't take away your ability to tow a trailer.
cons: The surface coating may wear off over time

customer_reviews.title: I love this step
customer_reviews.text: These are $30 at HD. It looks good and it makes it easier to get in and out of my truck bed ***Update 07/30/16*** All of the coating came off of the step. The Aluminum is corroded and looks horrible. I took it off, cleaned it up with a wire wheel, primed it and put 2 coats of rattle can bed liner on it. I love the step and can't live without it. I wish the coaring had held up longer.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Great concept Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I lobe the concept of this cause I pull a trailer daily and have a generator in my truck bed that I have to fill and turn on etc. so a step seemed like a great solution! However upon putting on the bolts are hardly long enough and one of them even snapped. I used my own strong bolts to install. While it is a fairly inexpensive product, I expect better quality from a name brand product. This seems to be the only product like this on the market though so I don’t have much choice but to keep this one. Go Rhino used to make a similar one but it has been discontinued it seems :(
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've only just installed this and therefore haven't used it much. So far it's everything you might assume it is. If it breaks or otherwise fails I will update this review. The hardware included seems decent, I like that it has nylock nuts. This isn't the type of thing you want loosening up on you. Someone could have a nasty surprise. Something about this is that it locks and holds the ball in place while you tighten the large nut on the bottom. I actually bought this MOSTLY for that function, rather than the step. The step is just an awesome bonus!
customer_reviews.author: KenjiFox

customer_reviews.title: followed the advice of priming and painting it
customer_reviews.text: The photo shows I stripped one of the screws off. And although I have a standard receiver hitch, the plastic spacer was no longer needed to install with the step as I replaced my ball with a reese interlocking ball, which worked well with the step base as it is shaped for the proprietary interlocking reese ball... followed the advice of priming and painting it based by one of our reviewers. Its gonna work well on my Tacoma as I haul around my teardrop camper trailer. I purchased the "Like New" product and saved a couple of bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Nice step, does not work well with Curt 2" 7500 lb ball.
customer_reviews.text: Boat this for the boat hitch. When using a traditional ball with the 2 flats, you need to remove the ball from the hitch to install the plastic adapter. The one I received did not come with Phillips head screws as shown in the picture, but standard hex head cap screws. ***Note*** The included plastic adapter does work with a Curt 2" 7500 lb ball. The opening not big enough and needs to be filed down to fit this ball. Or you can remove the smallest portion of the plastic insert and let the step be a little loose.
customer_reviews.author: kojimep

customer_reviews.title: older male and solved my getting in the back of my truck
customer_reviews.text: i have carried a 2 step step ladder in my truck where i could get in the back of my truck but now with the tail gate up i have three steps to get something out of the truck if i need to , 2 steps on my step bumper and this new added lowr reese step which is perfect height for my first step , now if i need to get in the back of my truck with the tail gate down i still use the 2 step ladder but that just not to often, works great and looks just as good on the truck
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: 20 bucks, easy to install, adds a step to the back of your truck. What's not to love.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my F250 because I didn't have a step to get up into my camper. I had a ball hitch there anyway. Might as well use it. looks good, installs in about 5 minutes and only 20 bucks. There were lots of options for hitch mount steps on Amazon but not for this price. and none that let me use the ball at the same time. I'm about 210....OK 220...5 whatever. and i have confidence that it won't brake even if I jump on it. So, yeah it's pretty good. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pete from Mass

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to have step.
customer_reviews.text: I have an F450 and the rear bumper is relatively high even for someone over 6'. This is just what I needed. My only ding is that since I have a class V hitch the screws included weren't quite long enough. I had to purchase stainless steel screws that were a half inch longer than what was included but that solved the problem. I has since bought a second one for my wife's F150 truck(No need to get longer screws for that one).
customer_reviews.author: TravisG

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable height and Very Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Very solid aluminum construction, no worries about breaking this unit! Also, it can be mounted on any drop of hitch mount for the height you need. I was also able to tow without interference and it does not foul my backup sensors either. Great unit and easy to install....would recommend using the Reese hex shaped interlocking ball and ball mount setup if possible, makes install a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Noullet

customer_reviews.title: Step on it!
customer_reviews.text: I took my time and installed it carefully, following directions and using the right inserts, and is holding on very well. good grip and enough surface to step comfortably and safely on it, yet doesn't gets in your way when moving around the back of your vehicle..... perhaps because I am already "shin trained" by the hitch ball... ;)
customer_reviews.author: GMMHEIL

customer_reviews.title: These Steps are great
customer_reviews.text: These steps are great. Much safer way to get in the bed of your truck. This is my third one and they are a must for short guys like me to get into the bed of lifted/4x4 truck. Sturdy construction and stainless hardware with nylock nuts (I also used LocTite). Can leave installed when pulling a trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma Happy Campers

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a step.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a step for my rear hitch on a pickup truck. This installs in less than 10 minutes on a Reese Ball hitch, WITHOUT having to remove the ball. I used Blue Loktite on the screws to keep the step secure. This is very stable. It does create an issue of bumping your shin, if not careful. But the benefits outweighs the cost or risk. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle VisionTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great step for easier access to pick up bed.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My pickup is so tall that I could not reach the built in step. This step with a drop down hitch makes it so much easier to access the bed of your truck. I am a big guy and it holds me just fine. Looks nice. Can't speak for the long term durability but so far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: sweetrick

customer_reviews.title: Ok product. But screws shown are not what is shipped. Won't fit on a heavy duty (thicker) hitch.
customer_reviews.text: Flat head phillips screws shown were not shipped. Hex head screws were shipped, which protrude from the step. The step only fits around light duty draw bars with thin ball mounts. so I will have to buy new screws to mount it to my heavy duty (2.5 inch bar, 1 inch thick ball mount) draw bar.
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable and very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2017 Dodge Ram for looks. Didn't really get it for usage as I use my Dodge Ram for shows. this product is very cheaply made. I have had it for a-little under a year with little to no usage and the square gasket is already fallen apart leaving it to look crooked. The paint is low quality as all the black paint has basically all flaked off naturally. I would not buy this again and would invest in something with better quality and durability. Don't waste your time or money on this product. If your looking for something cheap that wont last a year then this is the product for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Artiom Ryder

customer_reviews.title: The best investment for a lifted truck!
customer_reviews.text: Our truck has a 6.5 inch lift and this has been the best investment! We have a Retrax cover on the back so we step up to the back to open the cover before putting the tailgate down and wow we didn't even realize how much we needed this until we installed it. Price was cheaper on Amazon than Lowes and we are thrilled with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great step for the money
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to install. My only issue was the fit, and it’s not the product but my actual hitch. The nut that this step fits to is not exactly straight so the step is not straight. Still works fine and is a great product, just a little crooked due to the hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works as designed, but not out of way of trailer
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a Reese starter kit hitch - used it for luggage carrier loading and unloading. Works OK for this. Something of note is that my boat trailer did hit the trailer side edge of the lip that protrudes up on the left and right edge of the step, so it is not completely out of the way of the trailer. Depending on your trailer and how you need to park it, this may be an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Myers

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with all Reese hitches
customer_reviews.text: It did not work with my Reese 3.5 inch drop hitch so I had to put my other one on, which was a little disappointing. If you are looking for a step up to your truck bed when the gate is up it works for that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Had one on my last truck that I traded in and forgot to take it off before the dealership took possession, so had to order a new one for the new truck.....This step is very handy. I used it the very first day that I installed it. Its easy to install and lasts forever. Love this thing and in my opinion, there's not another one out there better than this one at the comparative price.
customer_reviews.author: ElCubanaso

customer_reviews.title: Gives me the extra lift I need.
customer_reviews.text: I love this step. It has helped with accessing the roof of my SUV and also climbing into the back. I use it with a reese interlock hitch so I did not have to use any of the adapters. It fits well and doesn't move around. I also use it with a anti-rattle hitch pin and it's pretty darn stable. I've stepped on this thing with wet and muddy shoes and the little grips work well. It is starting to fade a bit but that's expected since I rarely remove it and it's exposed to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: TXHoundUp

customer_reviews.title: Solid item, needs anti slip Patch.
customer_reviews.text: You really have to tighten this step down as it kept moving slightly when stepped on. If I ever take it off, I will add a couple of pieces of old tube squares before I tighten it down and that should give it more resistance from moving. Anyone reading this should do that for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It feels and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to give me a better place to stand when putting my boat in and taking it out of the water. The step mounted super easy with nothing more than a screwdriver needed. It is solid on the hitch with the only movement being that in the hitch itself. It also gives a much easier and larger platform to stand on when climbing into the bed. I used to just step on the ball but that was not always easy depending on the conditions I was in. This step is easy to see and offers a great surface to give you a lift.
customer_reviews.author: VVBulldog

customer_reviews.title: The step is really sturdy and convenient but it is constantly turning and not ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this in to help reach the top of my Yukon. I frequently haul things on the roof rack. The step is really sturdy and convenient but it is constantly turning and not staying straight. No matter how tight I make it I just seem to always find it turned one way or the other. I did like that it works really well even when towing a trailer.
customer_reviews.author: T.R. Hoefle

customer_reviews.title: Can't  turn a normal corner with a trailer hooked up.
customer_reviews.text: The product came missing a nut and bolt. They should have tightened them on. Update: It's crap. I replaced the bolt and broke it first time out. Bent it back but can barely turn. Good for a step and nothing else. See pic
customer_reviews.author: TheShaww

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Now you can't use it with your tailgate down, but its purpose is to get you up into the truck with the tailgate up. Looks fantastic with my truck. Very durable. I read some of the reviews and the issue with the screws being to small seems weird. The bolt/nut combo was more than sufficient to get a tight lock on the step. Love this attribute to my truck. I have a 2014 Ram 1500 Quad cab.
customer_reviews.author: smitty

customer_reviews.title: Step Up
customer_reviews.text: Great product, however, my toung mounted broke the right side off of this cast unit first time I pulled the trailer. Not for trailers with anything lower than the coupler.
customer_reviews.author: boze169

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pot metal broke on first use and hits trailer tongue.
customer_reviews.text: Interferes with trailer tongue. Cheap pot metal broke around screws on first use. Good idea. Terrible quality and implementation. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Dfwgreg

customer_reviews.title: Missing a bolt and another bolt broke
customer_reviews.text: It seems sturdy. The spacer was broken, but it was unnecessary. The bolts wouldn't have been long enough. One of the three bolts that did make it in the packaging snapped with just forearm torque. Replacements were not available at Home Depot so I ended up using 1/4 inch stainless Allens with nylock nuts. All in all a 5min install was 2 hours and another $10 plus a $5 SAE allen set. Still a good deal but be prepared with better hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Fading already
customer_reviews.text: I've had this on my truck for 2 months and it already looks weathered. I'm going to paint it with bedliner, but I'm astonished that I have to do so as early into owning it. Aside from cheap powder coat, it functions great.
customer_reviews.author: maddiedog

customer_reviews.title: 3 Stars, maybe it should get 4.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for that extra step you need getting into the bed. The negative is, if you have to back up to a trailer at an angle, it makes it difficult to hitch up. That is not a fault in product design, it’s just the location of some trailer security chains and welds.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Public

customer_reviews.title: Gets me higher
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my Reese drop hitch. Also works great on another brand hitch I bought. The inner plastic piece to limit slop only fits Reese hexagonal hitches. If you remove the plastic piece, it "Can" move around a bit, but tightening the bolts down seems to work just fine. I'm a fat 300lb dude. Didn't break for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, good looking and durable
customer_reviews.text: Love this step. Had a Rhino, which looked great and was long in the back bumper, but was not very durable as the smaller step ended up getting bent. This step is very durable, hold 500lbs and looks beautiful. I would recommend this step to anyone that already has ball hitch.
customer_reviews.author: hector colon

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Strong solid and easy to mount.. This is an excellent product.. It also comes with inserts for a couple different types of ball hitches besides the Reese Hex ball.. It also looks great..
customer_reviews.author: Lil Scoot

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Poor construction quality. The supplied bolts are not long enough (two sets of nuts and bolts were missing when I got mine). I have a thicker Reese hitch and the gap between the upper and lower plate makes it look ridiculous. It might work better if you have a slim, low weight rated hitch but doesn’t fit like it should and feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Too Bad
customer_reviews.text: It's a little smaller than I thought it would be for a step, but I didn't pay attentions to the specs before I ordered. Other than that, its a nice piece.
customer_reviews.author: Paul From GA

customer_reviews.title: Great hitch step.
customer_reviews.text: Great hitch step. The spacer worked good with my curt hitch no issues. Big enough to comfortably step on without looking ridiculous. Highly recommend this product and the bolts were tightened down no issues didn't break or strip.
customer_reviews.author: John gallagher

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Prevents the banged up shins and knees from ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Prevents the banged up shins and knees from when I used to step on my hitch ball to access my roof rack and would slip off. This makes a good secure stable step so I can load and unload items from my roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Nice extra step, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Nice extra step, easy to install, makes climbing up into the bed of my lifted truck easy. Could be sturdier, all your weight is held up by four screws.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great step
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of this type I’ve owned. The first one was different brand and somewhat loose. This one is sturdy and works well as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Texas George

customer_reviews.title: Plastic insert is a let down.
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked it more if the insert was made out of metal instead of plastic. My trailer barely came in contact with the step and the plastic insert broke. Now, the step can still be used but it rotates around the hitch ball when pushed on 1 end which could be a safety concern.
customer_reviews.author: SilverKnightCLS

customer_reviews.title: A most if you have a large truck/SUV with roof rack
customer_reviews.text: I have a Toyota Sequoia and having this helps me a lot when taking things up or down from the roof rack (SUP and other camping gear).
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Escobar

customer_reviews.title: A bargain for the quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solution for a step into a high Sprinter van. I used it with a drop-hitch which was also a Reese. I suppose there will be some heavier folk who think it this step is not strong enough but for my weight (200) it's perfect and at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to make getting into back of Tahoe cargo space easier. Most hitch step options out there cost twice as much and only serve as a step. This one serves as step and maintains ability to tow. Easy enough to install and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Perez

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Makes it a lot getting in and out. Especially getting out. Very sturdy. I’m 330 lbs and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jody murders

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Slapped it on my Reese hitch on my 2005 Tundra. Five minutes and done. Works as expected. Good price, good quality
customer_reviews.author: Lord Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Used a Lot
customer_reviews.text: Easy to Install. Like It So Much. It's a Extra Step.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a step to get up on the back of a truck or SUV then you need this. It's very sturdy. Trust me. I am a bigger guy and haven't had any issues with it. Very easy to install. Doesn't catch on a trailer ether.
customer_reviews.author: Ian manning

customer_reviews.title: Looks great also functional
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works great on my ram 1500. I leave it on all the time with a hitch ball cover packed with grease to prevent rust on my ball
customer_reviews.author: Justin Basford

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2-months and only had a person at 180lbs.
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up very well and broke after a couple of months of very little use
customer_reviews.author: Butch Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Easy install. Adds a step to my truck bed. I keep bright orange tape on the corners of this for visibility, and I haven't walked into it like I have walked into my ball hitch many times in the passed.
customer_reviews.author: Miki Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: really easy to install. Heavy duty. I feel stable standing on it...it's pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Great hitch step.
customer_reviews.text: Adapter didnt fit for my curt ball, but still works fine. Great shin buster.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice step.  safer than standing on greasy ball.
customer_reviews.text: This product is straightforward and seems to work well. Time may be different but the quality seems good. Notice you do have to remove ball to install properly as per instructions. This was not a problem as I was doing a new installation, but it may be a problem for some.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece very useful specially if you got a high truck
customer_reviews.author: Mr Valdo

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to reach in the back of my Yukon
customer_reviews.author: geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality materials
customer_reviews.text: We have bought two of these now and neither has lasted through two dump runs with a utility trailer. The washer in the center breaks almost immediately upon first use which makes the step wobbly and unsteady.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie C. Binns MSCN

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly and provides both a step and some added protection.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly and provides both a step and some added protection. Fits a Dodge Ram 3500 (year 2004) tow hitch with various sized balls on the hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: Garbage from China
customer_reviews.text: There is no way this is rated 500 lbs. My husband is 200lbs used this step one day before it broke. As you can see its cheap pot metal garbage. DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Cauchois

customer_reviews.title: missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: decent. Came missing some bolts with an open box. Replaced them and it works pretty good. Holds a good amount of weight fits different size/arrangements of balls
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great on the hitch makes it easier to get into the truck bed
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is excellent. Look good and works great. Installation is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't work in all applications due to contact with some trailers.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this product 3 stars because it will not work in my situation. I have two trailers out of 5 that have lower than the hitch and come in contact with the step on a tight turn. Picture is my boat trailer. Be aware of this before you buy. Otherwise it's a great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Huff

customer_reviews.title: ... response Other than the spacer all other pieces were good
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the PLASTIC spacer was lousy Wrote the company about it breaking and got no response Other than the spacer all other pieces were good quality
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Lane

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: Warning wont work alot of trailers depending on there hitch have to have clearence on the bottom of the tounge !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mike merriner

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect exactly what I was looking for. Highly recommend. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Provides a step to get to the top of the vehicle. My ford expedition is fairly tall and it allows me to get up and adjust things on the roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Hitch step
customer_reviews.text: Good, durable, quality product. Take into account it's small size though, which is comparable to a 12 inch 2x4. Doesn't extend hitch, and is great for hopping in and out of bed empty handed. When carrying a heavy load though, hitting that tiny step requires some concentration.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeside

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years it is okay. All the paint peeled of the aluminum. The aluminum is starting to go powdery.
customer_reviews.author: Razor

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing makes getting in the bed of my ram 2500 very easy
customer_reviews.author: Charles Green

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product and finish of product is very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to put this on my drop hitch, as my Suburban has 9 inches of lift. Am yet to find a drop hitch that will work with my lift for towing and this step. Will fit perfectly on a normal hitch. Wouldn't need the step though if my truck were low enough for a normal hitch. Quality of product and finish of product is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Let’s face it, I’m old and overweight, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Let’s face it, I’m old and overweight, but I still need to get in and out of my 4WD pickup bed from time to time. This does the job. Had one on my previous truck and it was smashed in a rear end collision that totaled the truck. I had one ordered before I picked up my new truck.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all truck owners!
customer_reviews.text: the best thing I bought for my truck! Using my trailer hitch to climb in the back of my truck and nearly slipping off many times I was happy to find this product! It fits nicely around my hitch and gives me a great foot hold for climbing in and out of the bed!! Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: valerie boessling

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: makes it easy to get on the back seat of my hi wheel golfcart. great product and fast service
customer_reviews.author: Woodsmoke

customer_reviews.title: Better than using the hitch as a step
customer_reviews.text: It's what you expect for 15.00 it does the job it is not a tight fit the rubber gasket doesn't work more for looks than anything. Better than using the hitch as a step.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdodgediesel

customer_reviews.title: looks good (not cheap or cheesy) and is solid
customer_reviews.text: Works well, looks good (not cheap or cheesy) and is solid. Used for a cross country trip in my Tacoma. Lived in the back during the trip and seldom opened the tailgate. The step was perfect for jumping into the capped back through the window. Doesn't affect towing - solid materials - looks pro.
customer_reviews.author: David Drupa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, bought a returned item and replaced missing ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product , bought a returned item and replaced missing bolt. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Huukt on fishing

customer_reviews.title: Nice trailer hitch step but it's doesn't fit a 1
customer_reviews.text: Nice trailer hitch step but it's doesn't fit a 1.25 receiver so I tried it on my other truck a 2 inch receiver and there is a space which allow the step to slide out of position which can make Somebody get hurt it must be for a 2.25 receiver
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height step.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Easy to mount, might be easier with 4 hands but I got it on by myself. Perfect step height for getting in the bed of my 2500HD with a service body on it. Save your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Scotto

customer_reviews.title: Access granted.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and made climbing in and out of my lifted truck for me and my family easier/possible. Saved money as compared to buying at the local auto parts store, big plus for me. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Noelia B. Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: way better than plastic imitations at a great Amazon price!
customer_reviews.text: pair with a reese interlock ball and hitch ( I used a 6" drop hitch ) and this thing works great! what a knee and shin saver. would be nice if you didnt need the ball on to mount it but it works very well regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Optimal Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great step
customer_reviews.text: Fit right on my hitch, holds my big body, 275# easily and makes getting into back of truck so much simpler, all for under $20.
customer_reviews.author: DC-Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit any Reese. If you have a 2500/3500 with the 2.5” guess what to think
customer_reviews.author: erik j.

customer_reviews.title: Broke!
customer_reviews.text: Had it on a couple of weeks and when my nephew stepped up in it broke! He is only 100 lbs. dissapointed in Reese product, thought that was a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: it's so great i love it.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition.
customer_reviews.text: Good addition to my truck. Just make sure the flat sides of the hitch ball are aligned with the receiver. Otherwise, the notches in the top bracket will force the step to bolt on crooked.

customer_reviews.title: Missing a bolt, recommend security fasteners

product_meta.title: Reese Towpower 7060200 Tow and Go Hitch Step
product_meta.description: The Reese Towpower tow and go hitch step is a unique, high quality constructed step accessory that fits interlock and traditional twin wrench flats to Reese Towpower ball mounts. It integrates into the system while towing. It is designed to provide an ease of use solution for any loading and unloading of cargo from any application, or hard to reach tow vehicles such as large trucks, vans, and SUVs. The tow and go hitch step also has a slip resistant tread surface with raised edges. Integrated adapter for ball mount versatility for use while towing. Easy, single-tool assembly (slotted screwdriver sold separately), and black powder coat finish for extended durability.
